title: Better calligraphy/handwrite
content:
Hi there!  
I'm back! Well, i always loved handwrite and calligraphy and i think it is the time for me to have a good handwrite and so. For two reasons, first... of course... a good handwrite by someone who loves typography, me! the second... it will help me since i love copperplate and canceleresc italics and so...  
So... where should i start? What do you advise me?
author: joelsantos

comments.content:
interesting... but not enough.  
i already have some type/calligraphy books. I already have some topics talking about that around here.  
Anyway, Thanks miseEnAbime. I need more! :P my handwrite... is ugly!

Joel Santos // yrmk

Choose some text you like, a favourite poem perhaps, or an aphorism.

a few things maybe to start with:

I'd highly recommend Doyald Young's 3 main books.

[Doyald Young](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720140723/http:/www.doyaldyoung.com/)

(Speaking of Cancelleresca, Doyald admires Van Krimpen and wrote about him [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720140723/http:/aigalosangeles.org/features/2003/12/jan-van-krimpen.php))

[Universal Penman @ bookfinder](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720140723/http:/tinyurl.com/6jykwg)

[Amazon books / Copperplate](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720140723/http:/www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_ss_gw/103-5366298-1615033?url=search-alias%3Dstripbooks&field-keywords=%22copperplate%22&x=0&y=0)

I know those ones thanks anyway :)
